overview:
## Discussion

Each 16-bit integer value in this array represents an index into the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARPlaneGeometry/vertices-43kle] and [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARPlaneGeometry/textureCoordinates-p801] arrays. Each set of three indices identifies the vertices that form a single triangle in the mesh. You can use array as an index buffer for a triangle mesh in GPU-based rendering or to create 3D model asset files.

# triangleIndices

**Instance Property**

An array of indices describing the triangle mesh formed by the plane geometry’s vertex data.

## Declaration

```swift
@nonobjc var triangleIndices: [Int16] { get }
```

## Discussion

Each 16-bit integer value in this array represents an index into the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARPlaneGeometry/vertices-43kle] and [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARPlaneGeometry/textureCoordinates-p801] arrays. Each set of three indices identifies the vertices that form a single triangle in the mesh. You can use array as an index buffer for a triangle mesh in GPU-based rendering or to create 3D model asset files.

Each set of three indices forms a triangle, so the number of indices in the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARPlaneGeometry/triangleIndices-64epx] array is three times the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARPlaneGeometry/triangleCount] value.

## Accessing Mesh Data

- **vertices**: An array of vertex positions for each point in the plane mesh.
- **textureCoordinates**: An array of texture coordinate values for each point in the plane mesh.
- **triangleCount**: The number of triangles described by the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARPlaneGeometry/triangleIndices-1azi3] buffer.
